properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 2:17PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
Rainfall will continue to fall across parts of southeast Missouri
and southwest Illinois through at least 5 pm CST. Some of this
rain could be heavy at times, with an additional one half to three
quarters of an inch of rain possible.

Radar estimates and rain gauge reports of three quarters to
locally one and a quarter inch of rain have already fallen over
this area since the rain began this morning. The highest rainfall
amounts have been noted in an area from Marble Hill, Marquand,
Pocahontas, northward to Silver Lake and Longtown Missouri and
onward to Rockwood and Gorham in southwest Illinois.

Although no flooding has been reported so far to the National
Weather Service in Paducah in this area, small ditches, creeks,
and streams will likely to reach near bankfull before the rain
ends later this afternoon and this evening. Ponding of water is
expected on some secondary roads as well.

If you are traveling this afternoon, especially over parts of
Bollinger, Perry, Cape Girardeau counties in Missouri, as well as
Jackson County in southwest Illinois, be watchful for ponding of
water on roadways and in low-lying areas. If you see water
covering the road, seek and alternate route to your destination.

If you do see a flooded roadway, please report this information
to your nearest law enforcement agency for relay to the National
Weather Service in Paducah Kentucky.

NWSheadline: Locally heavy rain still possible through 5 PM
